title: The Codem Echo
excerpt: Created an infinite free voice API for a hyper-realistic Text-to-Speech model and integrated it into a custom local AI assistant using Ollama and Speech-to-Text.
author: Codem
content:
Project Overview: The Codem Echo

A new tool has been released for hyper realistic voices through text to speech. It is quite an interesting tool to use and has a full api via hugging face. Though its still limited due to tokenization and daily limits.

Technical Implementation

Bypassing API Limits

Using selenium and opening the web tryout version, I created an infinite free api for it, allowing me to get a little slower but just as realistic voices. And by navigating a bit, I can manipulate the chosen voice as well.

Connecting the Voice Assistant

With the help of this new tool, I connected it to a custom modeled local ollama with Gemma3:1B for generation and made a full voice for my ai assistant. Also with the help of the speech to text python module, I had it listen for the word echo at all times, essentially making a free version of a voice assistant with infinite uses.

You can check out my portfolio to see more projects.
